content: Yes, Stoics do believe in enjoying life, but in a manner that is consistent with their principles. They believe that true lasting happiness comes from leading a virtuous life and finding joy in simple pleasures such as spending time with friends and family, pursuing interests and hobbies, and appreciating the beauty of nature. They also think that moderate enjoyment of food and drink is acceptable, as long as it is not indulged in excessively or foolishly. However, they reject the pursuit of pleasure as an end in itself, and see it as a fleeting and unreliable source of happiness. Instead, they advocate for finding contentment in virtue and living in accordance with reason and nature.
